main event: A bright glare/object was observed just above the top of the mountain range at 270 degrees azimuth in San Jose, California. The object was described as egg-shaped, approximately 30 feet across, and emitting a bright glare. Over the course of several days, two additional sightings were reported in the same general area - one with a star-shaped object the size of an automobile and another with a very bright glare moving slightly to the north.
interesting points: The first object was stationary or hovering just above the mountain range and was observed for 5 minutes.
The second object was star-shaped, larger than an automobile, and had a bright glare like a star but much brighter. It was observed for 2.5 hours.
The third object was described as a very bright glare with very slight movement to the north, observed for 2 hours. A private aircraft flew under this object at a much lower altitude.
The observers included a sheet metal fabrication operator and an unemployed woman, both of whom seemed reliable according to the report.
The report notes that there were no dwellings in the area where the objects were sighted, just fire roads and limited public access.
sighted object: Bright glare/object, star-shaped object, very bright glare
witnesses: sheet metal fabrication operator, unemployed woman, and their parents
